text: A beautifully done, simple dinner of chopped salad, lamb, filet, au gratin potatoes, asparagus and wine. I'm particular about how food is prepared, and every dish was done perfectly. And our server "Patsy" was a pro. Wine list has a nice range of selections. Only negative was smell of smoke drifting in through entrance. But food was so good it didn't matter. So glad I took my wife here for a special birthday dinner.

The Charcoal seems to have an identity issue. The food is consistently good, although they may need to find another fish supply. This restaurant suffers from the same malady at times as other food outlets at Santa Fe = shortage of staff, which seems almost chronic. Lately, the Charcoal has employed a singer, strumming a guitar, and proudly singing what I would classify as college songs.
C'mon......  Everyone seems to ask the hostess for the back of the restaurant when they walk in and hear him bleating out these ole dorm classics.
Charcoal room....... maybe send him packing to Cabos, dim the lights 1/3, kill the music down to 10 decibels and make it a classier place to eat.
Still, music or not....great food, usually great service...
Had dinner here a few times. I love the Lamb Chops. Caesar salad is good. Excellent customer service. Waiter came to our table often. Positive and relaxing atmosphere. Highly recommend.

he Charcoal Room at Santa Fe Station is where we come when we want more of an upscale steakhouse without breaking the bank. Since it's not far from the house, we usually try to get up here every other month or so. The meals and service are always outstanding.

The restaurant is tucked away in a corner of the casino not far from where the front doors used to be before the casino underwent many of its makeovers. You might not expect a local's casino such as this to have a fine dining establishment, but the Charcoal Room has survived when many of the other eateries that aren't in the food court have come and gone. One complaint is that the dress code has gone down somewhat over the past few years. It used to be business/dressy, but it seems that we see a lot more people in here dressed in shorts and t-shirts. However, they're usually seated toward the front doors or the bar area, so the good seating in the back is a bit more refined and romantic (except for the TV over the fireplace).

Although it has seldom been busy when we've gone, reservations would be recommended on Friday and Saturday nights. Request a table or booth in the back of the restaurant to avoid the noise of the bar and the flow of people coming and going. When arriving, we've never had to wait more than a minute or two until the hostess took us back to our table. Once seated, the waiter stops by the table promptly to introduce himself and take your drink order. They have a large selection of wine, so if you're planning on having wine with the dinner and aren't sure what to order, don't hesitate to ask the waiter or sommelier. They'll listen to your wine preferences and recommend a few wines that will pair well with your planned meal. They don't push the most expensive wine or the one with the biggest profit margin. We've found some good wines that we normally wouldn't have picked out.

We always begin our meal with a starter and can heartily recommend the stuffed Portobello mushrooms, crab cakes, bacon wrapped shrimp, or the bacon wrapped scallops. We usually choose the scallops and they're always perfectly cooked. Since this is a steakhouse, we don't change our order that much on each visit. I usually have the pan-seared ribeye and Brenda gets either the petite or full size filet mignon depending on her appetite. The steaks are always cooked to what you order. We don't have to order our steak rare to get one that is medium rare like some establishments. Dining is a la carte, so your sides are additional. The grilled asparagus, baked potato and garlic mashed potatoes are all tasty. They don't have the garlic mashed potatoes on the menu, but the chef will usually whip some up for you.

During the meal, the wait staff checks on you often enough to make sure you don't need anything else, but they're not intrusive. They are staffed well enough so it doesn't take more than a slightly raised finger or nod of the head to bring the waiter to the table. Every time we've been there, the head chef has always made the rounds of the dining room to personally ensure that everyone's meal met to their satisfaction. Instead of cheap Styrofoam, any leftovers are placed in disposable plastic containers and given to you in a nice red Charcoal Room bag.

Just writing this review makes me want to give our host a call to set up reservations for another meal here.

The bartenders were great, the wine by the glass selection was very good and reasonable.

The dining room service was spotty.

I ordered the lobster chowder and the filet sliders w/ creamed spinach.

I had to send back the chowder as it was bland, underseasoned and tasteless.

The sliders were great and cooked to a perfect MR.

The spinach was underseasoned and underwhelming.

My wife ordered the petit filet Oscar style.  It was cooked perfectly, but they forgot the Oscar.

Could it be that hard?
Everything about this place is terrible. The steak was dry and tough. I asked for a rare and got a medium. The service is a complete joke we had to wait 20 minutes just to get our check.

I can honestly say this was the worst meal Ive ever eaten in Las Vegas! Very over priced, everything is separate!   Well we had company in town they picked going to the Charcoal room ...this was the 7th of October now. We orderd a 32 ounce filet whitch was not even close to that big! a baked potatoe that was cooked sometime a week ago or something and a salad marginal..also orderd a side of asparigas which was very big and tough...I orderd a new york and it was a strip steak  not what I wanted very tough only ate a couple bites and no more the waiter was very slow and we even ran out of water! was never asked if we wanted desert mayb you dont have it?  when you run out of water at a table to me is not good! our company orderd two t bones and a salad and a glass of wine...the whole bill was 195 or something they gave him a 20dollar tip for some reason i dont know why! It was not what I expected from a guormet restaraunt thats for sure!  I didnt complain because we had commpany what good would it have done anyways! nothing is the santa fe is anygood!
We went to dine on my birthday,... very rude wait staff who do not wash their hands. Food fair but terrible service. we won't dine there again. I suggest you don't either for the sake of your health.

Love this spot! I go here with my dad. We went this past week, usually the food is great, however they gave us the wrong steak and said we ordered the wrong steak (which we didn't because we double checked). It's okay though, the pretzel bread alone will keep us coming back!

Wowza! We were hosting some friends from Oregon and wanted to go out for a nice dinner on Saturday night. We weren't in the mood for the strip and I had a coupon so we decide to take a chance on the Charcoal Room. The atmosphere was nice and upscale.  When fresh, hot bread was served we though we might be on the right track.  Our server, Misha was very helpful, made some great suggestions and was very attentive and professional.  We were all extremely pleased with our meals.  The French onion soup was the best I've had in years and the Caesar salad was huge enough to split.  Our steaks were cooked to perfection and were incredibly flavorful.  The cilantro sauce was delicious and my friend was extremely pleased with her scallops. Great flavors and large portions at a good price... We couldn't have been happier and will make it a point to return again and again.

Stopped for the sirloin and lobster special.  Waiter told us the steak was not quite up to what they normally serve, he was right; however, the sides and lobster and service were great.

Honest waiter, lived up to expectations.

Awesome service, food and atmosphere!!! The waiter was very friendly, attentive and efficient.. I can't say enough about the food... It was delicious from the bread to the appetizers to the main dish. My party seated promptly, and I loved the wine selection

The best place for a Filet in Las Vegas. We also had the Sea Bass, it was fantastic. The spinach salad and the au gratin potatoes were equally delicious. The service was wonderful, just a few reasons why this place is one of my favorites!

Been here at least twenty other times; this was previously my favorite local steakhouse, even though it is a bit pricy for many locals.  The food, service and ambiance has always been enjoyable.  So for our anniversary last Friday night, my wife and I enjoyed Porterhouse Steak, Broiled Sea Bass, French Onion Soup, Oysters on the Half Shell, and sides of Scallops, Au Gratin Potatoes, Creamed Corn, plus Chocolate Cake for dessert.

What I didn't enjoy was the explosive diarrhea that struck me moments after coming home, and which lasted about 18 hours.  I suspect the Oysters were bad as they were the only item which my wife didn't taste, and she was fine.  The following day, I wanted to warn the restaurant that their Oysters may be spoiled, but no one took my call.  So I left a message for the Food and Beverage Manager, who never bothered to call me back.
Great food, good service, no more Turtle Cheesecake !!! They took it off the menu with the Lemon Cake!! Unreal.

Amazing place!! I was first introduced here by my Mother and Father in law.  I had the filet mignon and it was perfect! It was tender juicy just the way I expected for a perfect steak.  The second time we dined here was with my wife, and the gentleman who was sitting next to us on his way out recommended the rib eye on bone. Let me just say that the rib eye was almost bigger than my head and the flavor with just the perfect spices made every bite salivating for the next one.  This is my first review and I highly recommend The Charcoal Room and when you do.. Ask for the Rib Eye on bone.   I promise you will not regret the choice!  :)

The scallops were fishy and gritty... very disappointed with meal. The lobster tail was not as advertised, less than 6oz cooked, the tail was listed as an 11 oz tail, prepared horrible, overcooked.. Im so disappointed in the seafood,  will think twice about returning

Well, I got no one to blame but Myself. I read the reviews and still went. AAAND, I'm taking time out of My life to write this. The Charcoal Room ain't what it used to be. I took My visiting Family there last night(Tuesday). This was the only resturant I ever ordered the Porterhouse. It used to be incredible, now, it just needs laces. Had a reservation, only one booth open, the first one, the rest were dirty, the hostess told Us. The waiter spoke broken english. OK. The steakhouse chopped salad, was chopped about 3 hours before We got them, light on the dressing, almost like a soup. Not crispy at all, no flavor.. My steak, I ordered medium rare, was medium. Fortunately, My nephew ordered his NY steak medium and it came medium rare, so I ate most of his and took mine home to My pooch, even she was dissappointed. The colossal baked potato was poor quality, soggy skin, hard and cracked inside...old. The Mac and Cheese, those bastards!!! Yep, also made too far ahead. I would say the service was good except for two things. One, Nobody ever asked how things were. Two, when you're a waiter and you're putting a coustomers entire steak(less 2 bites) into a doggie bag, don't you wonder why? The worse thing about the Charcoal Room is...........I ate there when it was incredible. Too bad. I don"t recommend it to anyone. I won't be going back. Oh, and, adios.

We indulged at "The Charcoal Room" for the first time Wednesday evening Dec 1.  Beautiful, Very Clean (wish i woulda thought to take pics), Excellent Wait Staff.  App'd on Seared Ahi Tuna (12.00), Crab Cakes (12.00), for both of the app's, the presentation, quality and taste were worth the trip alone.  Beth had the Lamb Chops (37.00), they make a Guiness Reduction Sauce with them . . Very Good.  I had the Organic Whole Chicken (19.00), baked, seasoned nicely . . Very Good.  Everything was nice sized portions (we took some home), and cooked perfectly/as ordered.  Happy to give them a 5 star review.

If you're getting a steak dinner anywhere else in town, I'm going to consider you crazy. I know this is a $$$ listed place, but you get so much for your money (and wine that's not insanely marked up) - and it's all delicious. And if prime rib is your thing, don't be deterred by the single menu offering, just get it if they have it. Pair it with either the creamy spinach or potatoes au gratin for a match made in heaven. I am seriously in love with this place.

Great service!!  We had a very large party, but they were very accommodating.  The food was excellent.  My husband enjoyed his fillet mignon with the garlic cilantro sauce. My bacon-wrapped bbq shrimp was juicy and enough to fill me up, and that was an appetizer.  I had the melon martini which was fruity and refreshing.  As with one of the other reviewers, they left the strainer as well for more to enjoy.  My friends and I had a great time.  The manager was very hospitable and checked on us often to see if we needed anything else.  

Definitely a place we'd visit again on our Vegas trips!!!
The ahi tuna and the lamp chops I ordered were cooked perfectly. The service was also terrific, and the wine wasn't bad at all.

We had the steak and lobster special.  Steak was not prepared medium. as requested.Steak was fine the second time. Lobster was cold
 both times. We have been there several times before with no issues.  Manager did remove from bill and admitted the special was not up to par..... Not many people there on a Friday night..??

Wednesday 7, no problem getting a table, there were 5 of us, steaks were marginal, one had the burger, kind of dry at medium.  For $20 should have had at least some cheese and bacon offered and you couldn't substitute anything, it'll be a long time before I go back here again, if ever.

Just left The Charcoal Room at Santa Fe Station in the Northwest part of Las Vegas.

6:45 dinner reservation for me and my wife. We were seated promptly.

Then we sat for 12 minutes without a soul stopping by to say anything. Finally someone stopped and asked us if we would like some water. My wife tried to order a martini from the bar. "I can't do that, but I can try and find your server." 

4 minutes later Patty showed up. We ordered bread (the pretzel bread is pretty good, I admit),  a diet Coke for me and the apple martini for my wife. Since we were concerned we might not see Patty again for a while, we went ahead and ordered appetizers and main courses then as well.

The diet Coke and bread showed up in minutes. The apple martini took 12 MORE minutes. It didn't arrive until seconds before the appetizers arrived. Patty apologized and vowed to find a manger to take some percentage off of our final bill for making us wait so long.

Crab cakes (appetizer) were ok. I'm a crab cake fan and these were no better than what you can buy at a supermarket and bake in your own oven. The crab meat to filler ratios were skewed waaaay too much in the favor of whatever breadcrumb-type filler they use.

The oysters on the half-shell were good - fresh horseradish, fresh cocktail sauce and tabasco. No saltine crackers like in some places but not a biggie. I felt they would've brought us some if we'd asked, but I didn't want to risk waiting 20 minutes for them.

Entrees arrived. I had a full-sized filet mignon and a lobster tail. My wife had pan-seared scallops and we shared some of the lobster mac n cheese.

My steak was a good-sized portion, appeared to be a good cut of meat and was perfectly cooked. Unfortunately it had next to zero flavor. That is NOT necessarily the fault of the restaurant as it appeared they did everything right with this filet. Sometimes you just get one where you did everything right with and it still comes out tasting like grilled water. I'm a steak aficionado and what I've read on this issue in the past suggests that the diet of the cow is the most likely culprit here, but even that is debatable. Suffice to say I don't blame the Charcoal Room for a properly cooked but flavorless steak - I blame the cow!

My wife's scallops tasted ok. On a 1 - 10 scale they'd be about a 6. It's pretty obvious to me that these scallops had been frozen prior to hitting the pan. That's ok if you're going to really take your time to make sure they come out perfect, but it's not okay if you're going to just slap them down for a pre-determined period of time and call it a day. You might get away with that using fresh or thawed scallops, but not frozen.

The sauces for the crab cakes and scallops appeared to be the same sauce and it was completely uninspired. A good crab cake remoulade usually has a "mustardy" (if that's a word) quality to it that bites back a bit when you try it. This sauce was mildly buttery but completely devoid of anything resembling a spice or flavor.

My lobster tail was the biggest disappointment. Again, it appears to have been cooked properly, but had a slightly overcooked, rubbery texture. Like the scallops, I would bet anything this is a result of using an improperly thawed lobster tail.

Incidentally, I realize that virtually ALL modern seafood is frozen at some point in its journey to your plate Yes, even the majority of sushi is frozen before you eat it - in fact, it's frozen before it leaves the boat that caught it! Several times I've stood in the Tsukiji fish market in Tokyo and watched the flash-frozen blue-fin and yellow-tail tuna hit the docks frozen solid before the morning auctions.

The problem isn't the freezing of seafood for shipping - it's in sloppy thawing (or non-existent thawing) procedures before cooking. That's what I suspect doomed my wife's scallops and my lobster tail.

The mac n cheese with lobster was good but not phenomenal.

We passed on dessert.

That "discount" that Patty promised to get us? Never materialized.

We'll not be back.

I was not expecting much from The Charcoal Room, but wow! The atmosphere was great, the wait staff was wonderful and the food was awesome. 
I had a moscato that was amazing. We started with the chef special appetizer- crab dip with sourdough bread. The dip was so good! I ordered the filet which was delicious and cooked perfectly. My boyfriend ordered the prime rib which he said was great. We also shared the lobster macaroni and cheese - so good with chunks of lobster in it. We had no room for dessert, but we will be going back!

Since we had a coupon ($25 for $50 of food) that was set to expire, my husband & I dined here for a belated birthday dinner.  Unfortunately, it didn't live up to our expectations.

Service was very slow.  It took over 5 minutes to be greeted by the assistant waiter, than 10 more for our head waiter to take our drunk order.  I had the lemon drop which was pretty good.  The wine recommended to my husband was enjoyable.

I had the onion soup to start and it was nothing special.  I ate maybe a fourth of it.  I ordered the petite filet and my husband the bone-in ribeye.  I chose the mashed potatoes and he chose the lobster mac-n-cheese.  (I don't eat seafood.)  It took a very long time to get our food. The steaks were nothing special.  My mashed potatoes are better.  These were bland.  We skipped dessert and won't be back.

I had heard this place had the best steak in town. I was very disappointed with the just about everything. When we were seated our booth was covered in food which my date sat in, the table was dirty and the food was just okay. It was not worth a 200 dollar meal for two, there are far better steakhouses in las vegas for the price. The one thing I can say is our waiter was very nice and kept my drinks filled. I would not recommend this place to anyone, again there is far better in Vegas at a 100 dollars a head.

Usually I don't head up to Santa Fe Station but tonight we were here to see a concert at the Chrome Showroom.  Our guest was craving a steak, I walked in expecting to eat at a little diner somewhere in the casino.  Instead, he chose the Charcoal Room.

First off, I am not used to high-end steakhouse dining.  Ellis Island is my average steak joint of choice.  A la Carte dining is also new to me but not an unwelcome option.  

This evening we showed up around 8pm on Saturday and were seated immediately.  The middle of the restaurant has a bar with plasma tvs; this was great for watching the Final Four games while dining.

Service was quick and excellent (helpful because the restaurant was not very full).  The bread options were excellent, from regular rolls to pretzel bread, there was plenty for the entire table.  Salads were optional and while I did not enjoy one, the others at my table were raving over a simple chopped salad.

My roommate and I ordered the 14oz Triple Peppercorn Steak while our guest had the 20oz Bone-In New York Strip.  Our steaks were amazingly soft yet crunchy with the spices making each bite utterly enjoyable.  We added a Lobster Mac & Cheese for a side that we all shared and this was equally as good.

While I could not afford to eat here often, if I wanted to treat a guest to a nice steak dinner with an excellent atmosphere but not stuffy enough you couldn't wear jeans and a t-shirt into the restaurant, this is the place I'd go.

Went there last night.  Saw yelp review. 
It was very good.  
French onion soup amazing?
Prime rib
Service 
Everything perfect.  
Plan on going again.

Went here for dinner, service was terrible, as well as the food. Crab legs way overlooked, vegetables cold. People that got seated after us got served before us. Manager was a real witch. Only giving 1?star cause I can't give them zero.

I really don't understand how my experience was so much different than the other reviewers.   Annoying semi-nice steak house with sports on monitors and tables so close together you're pretty much sharing a table with strangers.  Steaks were overcooked, sides were just ok. Service was painfully slow.  I was glad for it to be over.

Cheddar and Black Bean Soup earned this an extra star.  If you're ever going to walk through a casino to get some awesome soup, this is the place for you.

The table was too round, couldn't hear anything anyone was saying because they were so far away

The steak (porterhouse) was not cooked correctly, lifeless in flavor and I had to spit out gristle every other bite.

First timers and we had a great experience. We're locals as of a few years ago. We've had some great experiences at Steak Houses in town and have begun to discover that the less well known Casinos have some amazing Steak Houses (I.e. Circus Circus, Aliante and now Santa Fe).  Spectacular, aged, prime cuts cooked to perfection.  Service was perfect, attentive but not over done.  We will absolutely make this a regular haunt in the neighborhood.

Finally made it back and every bit as good as the first visit. Steaks were perfectly done, as gratin potatoes were spectacular and you MUST try the off-menu garlic / cilantro sauce ... it was flavorful without being over-powering.

Very disappointed with our prime rib. They do serve you a king cut price of meat, but the quality went right out the door. We both ordered prime rib, and both were CHEWY! That's not quality meat they are serving. Service was great, the sauces they offer, fantastic, we had the garlic, cilantro sauce and a Béarnaise sauce. I could eat it with a spoon, it was so good. 
  I will not be returning, the quality is NOT in the food.

This steak house is a joke.  The food had no flavor.  The service was slow. I ordered some mash potatoes and when they came out they were cold.  I was just looking to get a good steak and this is not the place
Always good food and great service at an excellent value compared to Flemings or any other high end steak house..

My husband and I ate here last night and I ordered the spinach salad which was excellent and the chicken (which I felt was only average) however my husband ordered the filet mignon and it was honestly the best steak I have ever tasted.   I will definitely go back but next time I'll order the steak.   It is pricey and everything Is a la carte.  But it was nice and I will go again.

To start: if cooked properly the steaks are out of this world. 
We had a 5pm reservation. Arrived at 450 and had to wait till 5pm on the dot. Fine since that's when they "open".
We've been here quite a few times. Every single time my mother in laws filet is undercooked. She requests well done, and while some may not like to cook a steak that temp , this is what she likes. The steak was pink throughout. The other 3 in the party- steak amazing. But poor mil, she sent the steak back asking for a well done filet. The same steak comes back charred on the outside but still slightly pink. For a 34.00 piece of meat it should be cooked right. And it just doesn't seem right to bring the same steak back. Now, the service was slightly odd. The waitress , I can't recall her name but it started with a J , and her help I believe was jordan. Anyway, they weren't rude but just lingered way to much. 
We won't go back cause honestly we'd prefer to all eat together ... hers is never right so... pass!

I took my girlfriend here for her bday dinner. And we loved every single item from start to finish. The menu is simple but has everything you want in a steakhouse. Service was great, everyone was very friendly. We will define come back here again and again! Thank you Charcoal Room for making my girl have a special night with me.
Have a really good ribeye juicy is heck the sides were wonderful specially the potato Grande
I absolutely love this place. It's my go to place and i don't have to go to the strip for fine dining. It's Definitely a gem. I highly recommend the cappuccino if you're a coffee drinker.

Happily surprised and satisfied by the meal here. My parents were locals and had vouchers and reward points to use here. Even though the casino itself may be dated, the Charcoal Room was one of the best dining experiences I had in Las Vegas and highlights the fact that the best food is found off the Strip.

All four of us had various cuts of steak, all with different seasoning and taste. If you like thicker cuts, try the porterhouse or the succulent prime rib - the prime rib especially with the cilantro sauce was out of this world. I had the petit filet mignon and added some scallops on the side - the menu no longer had the surf and turf combo others mentioned, but they still allow you to add on smaller portions of seafood to an existing entrée. No complaints about the scallops - cooked to perfection but just wished I got a larger portion for the price. The petit filet was wonderful.

Vegetarian sides were also a la carte and didn't come with steak meals.

The service was warm and polite and the restaurant itself was classy. I could easily see myself having a business lunch/dinner here with no concerns.

This will be one of my regular places to go to when I go back to LV.
Absolute BEST steakhouse in North Las Vegas.  Great atmosphere, wonderful service and worth every dollar.

I have heard good things about this place and we finally had a chance to try it for dinner. Nice atmosphere tucked away from the hustle of the casino. Our server Patsy was excellent. She was attentive without being overbearing. 
The meal started with a bread basket. It was fresh and so delicious. The pretzel bread was one of the best I have tasted in awhile. They also served a raisin nut bread and sourdough. Both were so tasty.  I had the seared ahi tuna appetizer. The sauce it came with was excellent. Great dish. I had the petite filet and sea scallops for my entree. The steak was so tender and cooked exactly to the temperature I ordered. I chose the garlic cilantro sauce and it was fabulous. The scallops were average meaning they were good but nothing special that I have not experienced elsewhere. We really enjoyed our meal here and will definitely come back in the future.

Our party of three visited Sunday night. We waited over an hour for a table, which was fine as we didn't have a reservation. 
Everything that came out of the kitchen was fantastic, the steaks, salad, side dishes were all great. The kitchen deserves five stars as they're doing their part really well. It's in the service that this place fails.
It started out fine, with our waitress and her assistant paying attention but not hovering, yet it would be nice if the waitress could have cracked a smile at some point. 
After our food was delivered, things fell apart fast. The manager came by to ask how we were right when we started eating, and we said "great", because the food is excellent. But then our glasses emptied and we began looking around for our waitress, who we hadn't seen in awhile as our food was delivered by someone else. Another waitress kept going by our table and we watched her, but she refused to make eye contact.Is it too hard to fill some glasses? The assistant was missing too, so rather than spending our meal craning around, I grabbed my companion's empty glass and went to the bar, standing to the left of the bartender who was using the computer screen. I waited, and she actually ignored me. Then the assistant eventually re-appeared and took my glass, but I stood there in the middle of the dining room for a few minutes being ignored.
After we finished, we sat there waiting to ask for a box, but again, no waitress. We waited and watched, then  eventually the assistant came over because we were just sitting there looking around. We had seen a dessert cart on the other side of the dining room and wanted to order two desserts, but by the time our waitress finally made her way back to us, she had our bill in her hand and wouldn't look at us. She asked if we wanted dessert, but it was with the bill sitting there in her hand, so we just said no so we could go.Then the assistant came to take our plates away and knocked a wine glass onto the floor at our feet, where it shattered.
The Charcoal Room has other locations, and the food is excellent, so we'll try elsewhere next time.
it was a great dinner time in this amazing Charcoal Room Steak House with a very good Steak. thank you very much.

We went to the location inside of Santa Fe Station for dinner on 7/4/17. The food was excellent , but what really made the night was our waiter, Kevin! Kevin is old school Vegas and is so entertaining while also giving 5 star service. Thanks to Kevin and Charcoal Room for an excellent evening out to celebrate a birthday!

OMG! This place is incredible. We are locals and FINALLY made a date night to eat here. Our server was Ralph and Phillip kept our drinks filled and brought out bread, butter, etc. Both of these guys did a fantastic job! Now, about the food-probably the best filet mignon I have ever had and the lobster tail was equally as tasty, My wife had the sea bass which I had a taste of bc I had never had tasted it before-DELICIOUS!!! We intended to post pics but when we saw the food, we dove right in and the pic idea was totally forgotten. Obviously, we highly recommend this place. I am planning on going back later this month. Can't wait!
Horrible. Maybe because it was Mother's Day. But everything was wrong: Service, food, even drinks. Maybe I need to pick another day to try it again.

When you come to the Santa Fe station, you expect cheap, discounted, so so food.  Well the Charcoal room is far from that.  

The moniker "you get what you pay for" works here.  Everything is al a carte .  I enjoyed all that I ordered.

I had Lobster(11oz), side of sauteed mushrooms & ceaser salad.  All was made excellently.  My wife had the petite fillet, extremely tender & flavorful.

I believe you will enjoy your visit as well...

Had some free time with the GF and we decided to check out the Charcoal Room at the Santa Fe.  Reservations were made with ease compliments of the yelp website for an early dinner.

We arrived and valeted on the south side.  This made for an easy walk to venue.  The hostess was pleasant and we got to choose between a table or booth.  I like booth when I am with my lady.  Sadly, when we sat down, the angles were all off. the table only moves forwards and backwards.  As a result of my current girth, I was pinned in.  We quickly chose a table.

The service was friendly and attentive.  We bused out with a coupon we had received in the mail.  They advised to give it to them in the end.

The GF started with wine and I started with a martini.  They shake it elsewhere and bring the shaker to the table.  After pouring there was enough left over to replace the half I had already sipped.

Foe an appetizer we decided to split a heirloom tomato salad with mozzarella.  It was a tasty way to start the meal along with the delicious bread.  Some how we had some self control and left room for the meal.

The GF ordered the scallops.  Pan seared or broiled....I can't remember.  They were a welcome addition to my beef to come.  Clean and not sandy.

I ordered up a Fillet Mignon.  Unknown how many ounces it was but is was not a petit for sure.  Medium rare was the call.  I believe it arrived on the verge of rare.  I did not care, my concern was with the GF.  No worries because she ate the half I gave her.  There was a nice cilantro & garlic sauce which accompanied the meal.

Our sides included lobster mac-in-cheese and a truly loaded backed Idaho potato.  First the lobster mac...It was cheesy delicious with a cork screw pasta (if memory serves) the not small pieces of lobsters and crunchy breading were tasty.  The potato was last as well.  I was asked if I wanted the cheese melted and I absolutely agreed.  It came with butter, sour cream, bacon, chives.  This was added to the potato and severed along with the remainder of the meal.

For desert the GF and shared a very berry crisp with a healthy serving of vanilla gelato placed on top.

All in all a pleasant meal decided upon in quick fashion.  Everything came in under a hundo with the coupon.  Not that fancy, as I wore jeans and a collared button up.  But the taste was fancy and affordable.  I look forward to trying again!

I give charcoal room five stars because they came through in a big way!! It was the night before my mom had to leave to go back over seas and she wanted steak! So I said what about the charcoal room?  She agreed and we headed on over. The entrance was nice and they have a wall of wine as you walk in and also have another wall of wine towards the back area. The hostess was polite and we were escorted ton our tables promptly. Our waiter was nice and he handled everything great. As we look over the menu we come to two choices the new york or top sirloin usda steaks aged for 28 days. Everything on the menu is a la carte and at $35-$45 for just a steak was a steep price. So we ordered oysters on the half shell,  coconut shrimp, asparagus,  baked sweet potato,  lobster mac n cheese, my mom had the usda new york steak and my lady and I both had the usda top sirloin.  Lets start with the appetizers.  The coconut shrimp was very tasty my inly complaint is that there is only three lol! The oysters were surprisingly great! Briney, with tobasco, horseradish,  and cocktail sauce was great! Now in the main event. The sides were great baked sweet potato was cooked perfectly amd accompanied with a cinnamon sugar butter, the asparagus was cooked theough and had a great taste, the lobster mac n cheese was awesome!! Tender lobster atop a bed of mac n cheese!! The steaks were out of this world. They were so tender, it was steaks that literally melted in your mouth and the taste was amazing. The seasoning tasted like a simple salt and pepper but it was a very good  blend and had a great balance! We had sauces to compliment our steaks (not that the steaks needed them) but we had garlic cilantro,  bernaise, merlot, and  bleu cheese sauces. All were great but we liked the garlic cilantro one the most. We then topped it off with dessert, new york cheese cake and creme brule. The crem brule was great custard had a nice texture and the caramelized top was done to perfection!! My moms cheesecake was to die for, it tasted unlike any cheesecake I had before and that was a good thing. You could actually taste the cheeses and it was awesome! So all in all this was a great experience and I will be back for sure. It was great to have such a great meal to share with my mom before she went overseas. Untill next time charcoal room have a great one!

Great food with fantastic ambiance!  I enjoyed the sea bass while my friend enjoyed the filet mignon.   Both were cooked to perfection!  Even our sides of spinach, brocollini and the sauted mushrooms were as tasty as can be.  It is no inexpensive, however, given the quality of food, ambiance and over part service provided by Ralph, his assistant Ray, and the manager Eric, the total was well worth the experience. 

Thank you Charcoal Room, we will be back.

We have been here many times and every time the food has been consistent! Steaks are always cooked to perfection!! Wish our server this visit had more of a personality. Her service was fine, but that's it...just fine. She was very dry and really didn't seem to enjoy her job all that much. However, her assistant Ray was excellent!!! Great personality and great energy!! Manager stopped by to introduce himself which was a nice touch.

My husband and I just moved to the area and we got some promo in the mail for this place so thought we would check it out. I have to say, I don't understand all the rave reviews. The hostess was barely nice - didn't seem to care. The waitress kept looking away while we were talking to her and having conversations with guests at other tables while we were ordering. Don't get me wrong, she was nice, just not as professional as I would expect at a place in this price range - really ruins the experience. For example, my husband ordered the porterhouse with a lobster tail and she forgot the lobster, so after his steak arrived, he had to wait 10 more minutes for his lobster. I think she wasn't really paying attention when we were ordering. On the plus side, they were really fast with the food. 

The pretzel bread is great and I definitely recommend the lobster rolls for an appetizer. 

I ordered the surf n turf. The lobster tail was huge which was great, but didn't taste very good - and I love lobster. The filet mignon was just okay and honestly I've had better at Outback Steakhouse for half the price. 

My husband thought his steak was good, but not great. And for some reason his lobster tail tasted much better than mine. Though still not awesome. 

The whole menu is al la carte so every side is an additional $6. I paid $60 for a tiny mediocre filet and one lobster tail and I can't even get some steamed broccoli with it? 

Anyway, we will definitely not be back. Not worth the money by a long shot.

Spot on. For a Monday evening we couldn't have possibly asked for a better dinner. Among the two of us we had the spinach salad, Caesar salad, fillet mignon and bone in rib eye. Everything was cooked as ordered and the meal was on time. The price point of the restaurant is really the best part. I've experienced meals just as good as this for 1.5 or even twice as much money downtown or on the strip in Las Vegas. Our only regret is that we didn't have room for desert. Do yourself a favor and order the maker's mark old fashioned before the meal. Cheers Charcoal Room!

Pros: Filet is buttery soft and delicious. Pretzel bread served hot and oh so good. Lobster bisque is perfectly made.
Cons: Do not sit in Diane's station, she has no pulse. Restaurant is too smokey, need to improve air filtration system. Cocktails are too pricey. Questionable neighborhood, valet park.

The food was really good I had filet Mignon and ribeye the only thing that bad bugged me was that after I ordered the waitress said veggies or baked potato? And I got baked potato not knowing it wasnt a side coming to find out i paid 24 for 2 potatoes. If I knew it wasnt a side I would have got a real side with lots of flavor or a starter,  so that kind of killed my mood. But other than that I like the music, atmosphere, and steak

We were seated at the exact time of our reservation. We were waited upon hand and foot. All left overs were put away. Food impeccable and tasty. So many flavors. Lighting and seating tasteful. Highly recommend and price range was perfect!

We went to the Charcoal Room last weekend for dinner. 

Our evening started with lackluster bar service. I suppose I expected a higher quality of bar service for what we were about to pay for dinner and not a woman with the sniffles, inappropriate tattoos for a steak house environment and a bad attitude. 

We were able to place our order with the waitress within 5 minutes of being seated. About 10 minutes later our food was brought out to us. This surprised me since our steaks were ordered medium well and well done but the presentation of our dinner was beautiful. 

Steak is a strange creature. So many people like it prepared so many different ways. What one sees as medium well another sees as rare, what one sees at medium another seems as well done. The chefs at the Charcoal Room must have 20/20 vision as they did an amazing job with our steaks and they were delicious. 

The plan was to stay and have two glasses of wine with a decadent dessert but that plan was thwarted by the earlier experience with the bartender. Maybe I should thank her. Due to her attitude we saved an extra $30 on the bill and had desert at home in bed.

I'm a bigger fan of the location at Palace Station- this one has similar dishes, but they're not as well executed. Came here with a large group for a birthday reservation, and service was very polite but spotty- timing of dishes was off and a couple of orders were mixed up.

I opted for the seared ahi app and the heirloom tomato and mozzarella salad. The ahi was a generous portion for $10, perfectly seared, and I enjoyed the tamari soy sauce but did not care at all for the wasabi cream. The salad was a disappointing mess of underripe tomatoes and flavorless "mozzarella"- it didn't even seem to be that cheese, the texture was crumbly and it was dry and flavorless rather than soft and mild. 

This location does not have a private room, but they were able to place us toward the back for some privacy. We were informed from the start that they were unable to do separate checks, which was a bit frustrating and led to several of our party using the $4/fee ATM outside. However, we were given a $40 discount card after being seated, which offset that inconvenience.

We went there Sat. night, got seated right away. Took 20 minutes for our waiter, Ralph to acknowledge us. Finally took our order with total attitude. He brought our salads out on a tray, left it there for 15 minutes..right next to our table while he had a joyous conversation in SPANISH at the table next to us. When he decides to give us our salads he just threw them down. Another waiter brought our dinner, he never came back till we were done, I ordered dessert and coffee, my lemon cake was frozen, and never saw the coffee!!! My husband tried getting the manager, but she had a big ol attitude just like the waiter and never spoke to us, she just rolled her eyes!
First and last time we ever step foot in there. Not a way to treat your VIP players.
Back to red rock we go.
P.S. the prime rib was 75% fat, we gave it to the dogs..total waste of $85.00.

we can't say enough about the charcoal room as we live only 5 miles from there. the staff are great and the food is superb. we like the prime rib and rib eye. along with the side you have enough for the next day. managers are always there and are real friendly. love the place. keep up the good service.

Has an excellent diiner Saturday night. Reservations made- booth requested.. hostesses very pleasant- Kevin, our waiter was very attentive. Miguel, buser- refilled drinks, brought bread-  terrific wait staff. Alam stopped by to wish us a Happy Anniversary. I had the King cut prime rib- cooked to perfection- my husband had the Colorado lamb chops with merlot reduction. And definitely try the pretzel rolls!

The service was phenomenal!!  We had an assistant server who served us our drinks and they left us our martini shaker with our glass and they were not reluctant to hold back on the alcohol :) 

Great advice as to what kind of steak to get because the Porterhouse was juicy, well cooked (way to go chef) and enough for two people!!  A side of the mashed potatoes was like getting some homemade from my mom's thanksgiving table they were so creamy and savory mmmm.  We also had the Australian named burger (something with a "W") and that was sooo goood tooo! 

Granted we were hungry but this place did not disappoint!

Place is great! Wonderful service from Corina at the bar. Sat down ordered some happy hour cocktails and food items. Service staff was friendly and prompt. Super pleased with our service today. Only thing I'd recommend is the short ribs from happy hour menu were really tough and hard to chew. Other than that wine was great and wonderfully priced. Thanks for the great service Corina, we will definitely be back

Up until my last visit the Prime Steak at the Charcoal Grill Room was excellent. At my last visit the Prime New York cut was the worst Prime I have ever tasted. It was poorly cooked and extremely tough. The host there brought out a second steak that was also tough. 
However, they did not charge me for the steak. Hard to believe the steak was Prime.....

We had a "my Vegas" voucher for $30 at this restaurant, so we decided to give it a try. Santa Fe station isn't too far from us, and we'd rather go here than the Strip or Fremont....if the food is good!
It WAS. Not only that, but we liked the elegant but relaxed ambiance of the Charcoal Room. Our server was competent (thanks for the recommendation to try the garlic-cilantro sauce on our steaks!), and the "busboy" (the guy who took our plates, filled our glasses, and packed up our copious leftovers) was really pleasant and on the ball. 
We had filet mignon, the fresh corn, mac-n-cheese, lobster chowder, and cheesecake. Oh, and the complimentary bread...hot out of the oven...yum! The steaks were cooked perfectly, and were piping hot. The sides were both amazing; the mac-n-cheese tasted like my homemade (I use the best cheese in mine), and the s.o. loved his chowder. My cheesecake slice was enormous, and the texture was sooooo smooth. ALL of the portions were huge...I ended up having most of the cheesecake for breakfast the next day; and we had a 2nd steak dinner the next night, with our leftovers :-)
The price is well under that of most Strip steakhouses or gourmet rooms. They had a decent selection of beers, wines, after-dinner ports (etc.) too. I would highly recommend this as a place to take guests, have birthdays, etc. It sure made our plain old Sunday really special! I can't wait to go back and try their ginormous lobster tails...

The hostess was not friendly and ruined my evening. The food runner was nowhere to be found, when I wanted a refill of the bread. My water was not refilled. The chicken marsala was excellent. Not a good value for the money.

It IS in the Sante Fe Hotel, however, it feels like you're in a sexy restaurant on the strip.  The atmosphere is perfect for those with a sophisticated palate, but lacks the loud music, and obnoxious attitudes... If I lived in North Las Vegas, I would love having this place close by without having to drive into town.

Now onto the drinks.  Pretty great wine list with everything from Stags Leap to Cakebread at prices you would expect to pay at a steak house. Had martini's at a prior visit that were excellent.

LOVE the lobster mac and cheese, creamed spinach, and filet mignon.  The 12 oz was enough to split with a girlfriend!

You can make it work on $50-$75 per person plus tip depending on how hungry you are.

This place has always been a favorite of mine for steak.. I don't think I have ever sent food back.. Kevin, one of the servers has been there for years and always makes the evening satisfying. I don't get there often enough.. but filet is killer.
Try them on holidays.. they will run bacon wrapped filet specials and it is one of the best things I have ever had.. Wish they would put that on the menu or make it available off-menu to locals.

I'm always excited to try a new steakhouse, but the Charcoal Room inside of Santa Fe Station unfortunately did not live up to my expectations.

The decor was lovely, all red and dark wood with lots of cozy circular booths. They had a singer in the front performing a variety of songs with a guitar. Service was pretty good, no major complaints there. Pricing looked very fair, especially given we were pretty far off of the Strip.

So, what made the Charcoal Room less than stellar? What should have been the star of the show- the steak. I'll get to that shortly. 

First, the good stuff. My crab cake appetizer was pretty tasty and a good portion. The crab wasn't lump crab meat and tasted like it was deep fried, but I enjoyed it nonetheless. The creamed spinach was perfect- tasty, creamy, and seasoned well. The mashed potatoes and sautéed mushrooms were also very good.

But the steak. Before I ordered, I asked our server the difference between their medium rare and the medium, because I know that some chefs prepare their steaks differently. He told me that medium rare would be pretty bloody, while medium would have a warm pink center. So I went with medium.

Sigh. It was barely pink and extremely tough. I was disappointed. The flavor was good, but I was filled with regret for not going with medium rare.

I thought dessert would help things, but it didn't. The carrot cake was store bought, and not only did it taste that way, the paper between layers was still in the cake- I got a mouthful of it on my first bite, before I saw it and pulled it out. Not good.

The sides, decor, and service are what pulled this to a 3 star review. Everything else- meh.

i find it so difficult to read bad reviews of places that i personally love.
it's as if i'm somehow getting lucky while everyone else is striking out.
that sux!!!

the charcoal room is definitely one of those places that i wish all of you who had bad experiences there had dined with me instead.
the outcome would've been quite different, i think.

we've eaten here 3 times and, each time, we've had nothing short of a positive, satisfying experience.
i always order a fish of some sort and have never had any complaints.
it's always seasoned well and cooked to my liking which is to say a perfectly medium rare piece.
my hubby always orders a steak and it has been consistently good.

but what i like most about this steakhouse, especially compared to other station casino steakhouses, are the sides and apps.
where most steakhouses put little care into their side dishes, the charcoal room seems to realize that the accompaniments and the main entree are of equal importance.
is there anything worse than having a delicious entree when the rest of the food sucks?
sometimes i judge a restaurant on whether or not the greens remain crunchy after being cooked.
i absolutely hate soggy greens.
charcoal room has never served me a soggy vegetable.
that's a huge plus, in my book.
This place was fantastic food was great service was on point. I had a few reservation requests and they were noted and carried out. Would definitely return!

One of my favorite restaurants, especially for those of us in the Northwest! 
Two words: Pretzel Bread...I could come here just for that. haha.
My boyfriend and I love their Caesar Salad, The Filet with Garlic or Peppercorn Sauces, and the hot bubbly Scalloped Potatoes. 

It's an affordable, yet elegant restaurant, dim lights, red theme. 
The staff is nice and attentive to your drinks. The hostess and management are pleasant and consistent! 

On occasion our service gets slow, but we aren't in a rush when we go to dinner here so that is just fine with us!
One of the best steak houses in Vegas. The service is good and the food is terrific. We highly recommend the bone-in ribeye. You will pay at least twice as much on the Strip and it won't be as good.

Amazing!!! Hands down one of the best steak houses in Vegas! Filet was perfect. Bone in New York was perfect. Au gratin potatoes and lobster mac was amazing! Anthony and Ray provided wonderful service! I can't believe we waited this long to come here, but we will definitely be back!!!

Haven't been here in a few years. We stopped by last night and this place is still great. The beginning of the meal we were greeted with a bread basket, which contained sourdough, raisin, and pretzel bread. I am not a fan of raisin, so my boyfriend was happy to devour each slice. I ordered a delicious Roasted Toasted Almond Martini. Next  Crab Cakes, Caesar Salad, and Lobster Chowder. All three were very filling. I had a Petite Sirloin and my boyfriend had a Prime Rib. The meat was cooked  to perfection. Our sides were Au Gratin Potatoes and Sautéed Mushrooms.... We were so full we didn't have room for dessert. This place was great some years ago, and it is still great.

We usually have a great time with delicious food at the Charcoal room.  We had dinner last Saturday and I have to say Im sad.  Our service was horrible.  The waitress seemed like she wanted to be anywhere else but working.  It was only 5:30.  My husbands steak was cold and rubbery and my filet was not cooked at all.  Even the potatoes au gratin were underdone.  It was my brothers b day so we told our waitress and at the end of the meal she practically threw the dessert at us.  We will be looking for a new steakhouse to frequent.  I wish we would have gone somewhere else and paid 280.00.
Steaks were cooked perfectly, Cream spinach was perfect and the lobster macaroni and cheese was outstanding

As a visitor in Vegas, I would have never known to go here unless I used Yelp. Off the strip for sure but still in a casino. No reservations needed on. Wednesday night but it filled up fast. I ordered the smaller filet medium rare and it was amazing. Side dishes where roasted corn (just okay) and tater tots which were outstanding. Server and staff continually checked in to ensure we were satisfied. Definitely check it out.

pan seared filet mignon is the best I have ever had.... hands down...
lobster Mac n cheese is amazing...
food here is immaculate... a must go.

Service was great...our server Anthony was very attentive.

Food was good too, we shared 24 oz porterhouse and it was more then enough. Out of everything we had, spinach salad and steak were the standouts.

Value was incredible, we did have $25 coupon we got in the mail, but even without it still a good value.

We had 3 martinis, ahi app, spinach salad, oysters, porterhouse and 2 sides. Bill was only $112.00 before $25 off.

For sure we would go again, dont let the fact that its in santa fe casino stop you from going.

Tried this steakhouse inside the Sante Fe casino after hearing great things but I'm sad to say I was left disappointed. The service was about the only thing that was great. The food itself lacked flavor. Nothing stood out In my mind. My ribeye was overly fatty and Although I asked for it to be cooked medium, it was definitely still "mooing" at me, meaning it was very rare. The mashed potatoes were dry And the creamed spinach was super oily. Sad to say it was not my favorite place.

Located inside the Santa Fe Station, the Charcoal Room is a fantastic steakhouse that offers great food at affordable prices!

Tastefully decorated in browns and reds, the room is very warm and inviting. This was actually my first time trying any Charcoal Room as a group of six of us were here to celebrate a friends birthday. 

Items ordered..

- Bone-in New York Steak (5/5) Seriously one huge slab of meat! The pics do NOT do it justice! Perfectly cooked medium. That sucker never stood a chance! Very tasty. Very juicy. Absolutely scrumptious! ($32)

- Yukon Gold Mashed Potatoes (4/5) Good sized portion, especially for the price. Very delicious. ($6)

- Mac and Cheese (regular) (4/5) Again, a very generous portion and very tasty mac and cheese! Nice crusty topping with plenty of cheesy goodness just below! ($6)

-Tater tots (3/5) Basket full of tots. Once again, a very generous portion. They were okay. Maybe they just couldn't keep up with the rest of the items we ordered, but they certainly weren't bad. I probably wouldn't get them next time, though.  ($6)

- Service was fantastic! We were treated VERY well here! We were seated immediately. Glasses were refilled in a timely manner. We were served plenty of bread. Our server was very outgoing and friendly. I was quite pleased with the service we got here.

Actually, I was quite pleased with our whole experience here! You really get a lot of value for what you pay here! The prices are a fraction of what you might pay at other places, but you don't have to sacrifice great food and great service for it! I can't wait to come back!

4 solid stars.
Purchased a Resturant.com certificate a year ago and can't believe I waited so long to use it.  The food was way better than I remembered and the Manager was amazing.

This has to be one of my favorite steakhouse to recommend and this is my second time going to the Charcoal Room. It's a great place, lovely settings, friendly staff, and of course, great tasting food. To me, the location was great, since I live here in Vegas, its just a few miles away from home, located inside Sante Fe Casino. 

As for the food, the first time went, I started off with the Bacon covered BBQ shrimps. Presentation was good, taste was great, I really loved it a lot. I would of order it again, but with the fact of my wife sharing her BBQ boneless baby back ribs, last trip, I loved those even more. So, on this visit, I just had to order a plate, for me. Other then that, we had mash potatoes and broccoli, but of course, the STEAKS. On my first visit I had the Fillet Minion 12oz, loved it so much, I had to order it again on this trip. Again, presentation was great, taste was fabulous, over all, my tummy was satisfied once again. If it wasn't for the bread basket, The BBQ boneless baby back ribs, the mash potato , the broccoli and the multiple refills of Pepsi, I probably would of done dessert. I'm sure dessert would of been fulfilling, but I was already fulfilled after making my 12oz fillet minion disappear. 

Sure enough, I would return to the Charcoal Room whenever I get a chance. It is kind of pricey, but take it from me, its worth every penny.

I was really looking forward to a wonderful dinner. It was awful. We had the chicken marsala. There was no taste of marsala wine it was cheap store bought gravy.The chicken itself was a chunk of breast meat that was completely dried out.We couldn't even cut it with our steak knives. The broccolini that we ordered was cooked in some kind of rancid oil. Because I was handicapped it's kind of a big ordeal getting into the restaurant. We asked our waiter to please just box it up. But what we did was drop it off at the nearest garbage can. I have only had chicken marsala that was a pounded chicken cutlet. This was a hunk of dried up chicken. The wine is very expensive and a very small amount the mashed potatoes were dry with no taste. We will never return we really felt ripped off.

Amazing food and service...period!  My date and I sat there talking until they closed.  They never asked us to leave nor do we feel pressured to leave.  I have never had better service.  I had crab cake appetizer and lobster tail.  5 star on both!

My second visit, again, I was here to see another movie I was anticipating and wanted to have a repeat of another steak dinner since my first visit.

This time I sat at the bar and it turns out, my bartender was Jesus, who happened to have been my waiter from my previous first visit.

When I ordered my drinks, he asked if I had been there before & I said, "yes."

I was impressed that he remembered me.

Later, Amber came along to take my order. 

I decided to try a new offering: honey glazed pork belly.

I also ordered the large fillet mignon with hollandaise sauce and a side of Mac n cheese.

I loved the pretzel bread so much from my first visit that I was given just that.

Same thing, warm bread and room temperature butter. So delicious!

And shortly after my starter arrived and what a combination!

The pork belly was tender, great flavor and nestled on a small bed of spring greens, and the tartness of the balsamic drizzle mixed paired well with the honey glaze. 

My steak and Mac n cheese arrived at the same time. 

WoW! 

The steak cooked perfectly cooked rare and seasoned that when cutting into it, was effortless. 

Dipped in a creamy hollandaise sauce made the two a perfect match.

The Mac n cheese topped with nice toasty bread crumbs with a cheesy, creamy body put my meal all together.

I like this place.


I like the customer experience, I love the ambiance, the food is definitely the entertainment.

If you're visiting this casino and want to enjoy a nice dining experience. 

Consider this place. You deserve a good night out.

:)
Best prime rib ever.  Also loved steakhouse chopped salad, lobster chowder, seared ahi tuna, and mac & cheese.  Not impressed with the creamed corn or beer selection.
Me and my fiance enjoyed our food, very friendly and calm environment, we will be going again. Thanks for an awesome service

Love the Charcoal  Room...my husband  & I ate here several times...however, the last time our party got sick so we haven't  been back. I do recall the flu was going around, who knows maybe an employee  was sick but more than likely we will return, just giving it a break so the last experience  will be completely removed from our taste buds. The customer  service  is always great!

Supremely disappointed at their lackluster implementation of reservations. My wife and I made a reservation online using Open Table. My wife and I walked in this evening -- Saturday -- and were told by the hostess Brenda that it wouldn't be until 8pm that we'd be seated. The hostess then got the manager when we complained about the wait time. He informed us that Open Table doesn't matter since -- according to him -- it doesn't track walk-ins. Unbeknownst to him I'm the former lead web developer for Station Casinos (the owner) here in town. So, I know that walk-ins are trackable in Open Table. You just have to be willing to enter them into the system.

This is a locals steakhouse! Unpretentious, reasonably-priced, steakhouse dining at its best. Charcoal Room is a restaurant where I don't have to worry about dressing to the nines, or feeling uneasy when a stranger drapes a white cloth napkin over my lap. 

Starters: The fried calamari is crunchy and delicious, and there no fillers, just all calamari with a side of peppers and dipping sauces. 

Entrees and dessert: The NY Steak is absolutely delectable and flavorful. However, the pan seared sea bass is my favorite dish on the menu; it's tender and the meat melts in your mouth. There are plenty of sides to choose from, and I like how there's the option to select how you want your greens cooked (sauteed, steamed, or creamed). If you still have room, their decadent chocolate cake is a perfect way to end dinner.

Okay, I definitely want to come back here. The steak was heavenly and the mashed potatoes and sauteed mushrooms were absolutely scrumptious! Get your wallets out because you'll be spending some dough here. Great place to go if you're celebrating an anniversary or something romantic.

Wow what a disappointment :(
The service was slow and the servers (attractive) paid more attention to the 2 other booths that had attractive men sitting at it. 
We had a reservation for 5:00 pm and got seated at 5:20 pm.
The pretzel bread stick thingys were delicious but the only good thing about the meal.
I ordered a filet. it was tough and had no flavor. I would have went to Applebee's if I wanted a steak that looked more like meatloaf.
For the $50 my portion cost I just wasn't happy.
Does anyone remember when they had a steak house called "Kodiak"? Those were the good ole days oh how I miss that place.

This restaurant is located inside Palace Station Casino.

The ambiance is pretty swanky. The menu has just the right amount of choices, and not overwhelming.

Our friends showed up right on time as we moved from the table (which was small to our liking) to a spacious comfortable booth. A fresh basket of bread is bought to our table, variety of bread such as raisin, sourdough, and pretzel bread. 

Jesus, our nice waiter, got our drink order. He was attentive.

The Wedge Salad, and Sesame Crusted Tuna were flavorful. Maple Glazed Pork Belly was ok. My favorite appetizer was the Seared Scallops. The depths of these bay scallops were very perfectly cooked. Our friends enjoyed their meal as well.

Wine and cocktails were a little pricey as was the food but I'm sure it's way cheaper than the Strip. If you're looking for a nice higher end steak place with great service, check out this restaurant.

This place is great! My family tends to come here for super special occasions, like my grandparents' 60th wedding anniversary last week. They make it easy to book a table for 10 in advance, which resulted in getting a table smack-dab in the middle of everything, making for quick & vigilant service.

It seems like each & every time, my sisters and I start throwing elbows for the pretzel bread they bring out at the beginning. It's just so good! Especially with a bowl of their French onion soup. .....Yes, it appears I have mastered the art of filling up on soup & bread before the real meal arrives, BUT that does notstop me from ordering the King Cut Prime Rib anyway. So good and sooo worth having to be rolled out the restaurant afterward.

I had to knock one star off for the lack of bread refills (I know this isn't Olive Garden, but goddamn, that pretzel bread is too good) and the grumpy waitress we had. She seemed annoyed & impatient with us when we asked questions or took too long to order. I felt genuinely bad having to ask for anything else from her, so I skipped out on a second glass of wine...

The steak was great but that was all. The service was terrible. I asked 3 times for some water and ended up leaving without any. They didn't clean any dishes from the table from appetizers on.  The $12 shrimp cocktail tastes like rubber shrimp. Sad really I'm a local and will never be back .

We  enjoyed dinner here last weekend. Great hidden treasure in the Santa Fe casino! I had the petite filet mignon and my guy had the Ribeye steak. Both were cooked to perfection and we had some tasty sides too. I'd highly recommend this fine restaurant. Our server was fast & friendly - thanks Diane!

The Charcoal Room was a first time for my husband and I. We were celebrating our 4 year wedding anniversary.  When I called to make reservations the actual restaurant phone was not taking messages because the VM was full.  
When the answering service "operator" took my reservations she asked if it was a special occasion  or just to dine.  I specifically  told her our anniv. She congratulated me and stated she would make a note. 
We were welcomed by the host who seemed irritated or bothered. Manuel was nice , he said he was helping Anthony. But to be honest all Anthony dud was take our order. Manuel as the one who refilled our water and asked us if we needed anything , then boxed our leftovers. 
Anthony was there to just act as if did something and have us the bill and quickly turned to what seemed like regulars.  
The food was fabulous. The owner walked passed twice and asked how was everything ?But didn't stop to listen to our response. I noticed she did stop to ask the same question to others too but then did listen for there reply.  
Throughout the evening no one mentioned our anniversary as the operator stated she would make a note of it.  Maybe they just didn't care but it would have been nice to at least wish us best wishes. Whatever.  If we ever decide to eat the charcoal room it will be to carry out. I can make it more peaceful at home or wherever with just the two of us and not so much rudeness. Seem to me the workers judge who's going to be a better table? From what I've seen Caucasians got more attention,smiles and better service than my husband and I who are both minorities.

We have been coming to this place for many years and for many years it has been great which is why when our last two visits were not very good with that we give it one more try. The food simply has lost its wow factor.  The service is going downhill... Not to the fault of the servers it's about understaffing a restaurant.   I waited 45 minutes for my water to be refilled on the last three visits... Not really cool. I'm not sure what changed or what happened to the Charcoal room but it's now just an average restaurant in the casino like so many others and in Las Vegas... Average simply does not cut it.    I'm sorry but you've lost a regular

Allow me to take you on a trip in my virtual DeLorean.  Strap in, sit back, and relax.  The flux capacitor is fluxing.

There!  See, that wasn't too bad.  Were now back in 2006.  October 2006, to be more precise.  Now here's my review...

My wife and I celebrated our three-year wedding anniversary at The Charcoal Room, a cozy little steakhouse located inside Santa Fe Station (a "local's casino" situated in the northwest part of town). In the more than ten years that we've been together, we've had the pleasure of dining at several fine restaurants across the country, from Aureole in New York City to Donovan's in La Jolla. And, as denizens of Sin City, we've also experienced some of the best food and beverage offerings available on the infamous Las Vegas Strip. I guess you can say that we are "foodies" by definition, and as such it takes quite a bit to impress us. With that said, however, the folks at The Charcoal Room did just that.

The place was pretty empty when we got there. I think there may have been two other occupied tables in the room and maybe two or three people at the bar. Needless to say, I would've been really disappointed if the service had left us wanting. The good news is that our server, I want to say his name was Anthony, and his assistants did very well. They were attentive, upbeat, speedy, and they demonstrated well-polished tableside manners. No complaints about the wait staff here!

Timing-wise, everything came out properly.

Where this restaurant really surprises and delights is in the quality of its food. Here's what we ordered:

    * Bacon-Wrapped Scallops (as our appetizer)
    * Glass of Pinot Noir - one of Francis Coppola's reds
    * Caesar Salad for Two
    * 12oz Filet Mignon - Medium but Charred (for me)
    * 12oz Filet Mignon - Medium Well (for my wife)
    * Au Gratin Potatoes
    * Sautéed Mushrooms
    * Some kind of chocolate cake and molten peanut butter confection

Phenomenal food! With the restaurant's pricing, I was expecting the food quality to register just a notch or two above what's available at Outback Steakhouse (the filets were only USD$30 each). But when I cut into my tender morsel of red meat goodness and chomped down on that sucker, boy, was I pleasantly surprised! Perfectly charred on the outside, just right in the middle, and superbly flavored. And the rest of the food was equally as good!

Compared to certain overpriced and overhyped rooms (i.e., the "fine" steakhouse located inside the Bellagio), The Charcoal Room is a breath of fresh air.

So far, I believe the best steak in town is offered at Del Frisco's. Second best can be found at Craftsteak inside the MGM Grand. Third best is served up at Fiore's Steakhouse inside The Rio All-Suite Hotel & Casino. Fourth calls Delmonico's at The Venetian its home. The fifth best steak is delivered by the talented folks at Mon Ami Gabi at Paris Las Vegas. And sixth best? You guessed it, The Charcoal Room. Not bad for a "local's" restaurant, methinks.

Overall Rating: Excellent
Food Rating: Outstanding
Staff Rating: Excellent
Ambiance Rating: Good

I made a reservation for 6 PM and arrived a few minutes in advance.  I was shown to a table in the bar area which was OK because I watched the baseball game during the meal.

I ordered my iced tea, got some bread, and got ready to enjoy a steak.  I only ate one piece of bread--the salted pretzel bread.  Very good.  

I started with a lobster chowder which was a lot like New England clam chowder but with lobster.  There was a good amount of lobster and the chowder was good.

Next, I had the bone in ribeye cooked blue.  The waiter said they averaged 22 to 24 ounces with the bone.  It was a nicely cooked large steak done almost perfectly.  The steak evidently wasn't pre-seasoned with any salt and pepper and I found myself putting salt on the steak.  As a side, I got the grilled corn with chipotle mayo.  That was the standout dish of the night.  The mayo and a nice spicy kick from the chipotle and when mixed into the corn, it made for a great side.

For dessert, they bring a cart to your table and show you the goods.  I went with the carrot cake.  The cake was quite large and it was very good.  The interesting thing about the carrot cake were the thin carrot shreds that were lightly candied giving a crunchy texture to the cake.  It almost seemed like the carrot shreds had been fried although they weren't.  Very nice touch.

Service was very good throughout.  My iced tea was refilled without needing to ask.  There's one suggestion I'd make.  I know you want to show an open restaurant to your clients, but when I'm in a casino steakhouse, I'd rather have the doors shut so I don't listen to slot machine sounds during dinner.  The Charcoal Room is OK.

Steaks are great. So far I've enjoyed the ribeye, porterhouse, and New York prime all medium rare and have never been disappointed. Mushrooms are not as salty as other steakhouses.  The horseradish mash potatoes are my second favorite(wasabi mash at Cali hotel is #1).  The servers and bussers takes care of you, and takes your experience to the next level. It is definitely worth a try.

Food was great and exceeded expectations. We have been to many other steak houses in the city and this is easily in the Top 3 if not #1. All 4 filets ordered were cooked perfectly, the sides were great portion sizes for the price and the staff was friendly/service was fast. 

It also is worth noting that the Sante Fe Casino itself has been cleaned and updated since our last visit. I noted new carpet throughout, a new concert area and updated movie theater.

Terrible experience.  The $44 (11oz) lobster tail turned out to be 3 ounces and so tough we sent it back.  We ordered prime rib and were unable to cut it with a steak knife.  What has happened to this superb steakhouse?  Just 2 months ago the food was delicious but, like other Santa Fe restaurants, the quality of the food has declined significantly.  Has there been a change in ownership or management?   Don't waste your time dining here...

I met a friend here last night and the food was terrible.  I used to go here often and the food was always terrific and the service excellent.  The bartenders knew what wine you drank and would customize the bread basket for you.

They changed the menu about a month ago and downgraded on the quality. They still have Ahi Tuna on the appetizer menu but it is not the same quality as in the past.  It tasted "off" and didn't even look edible.  My friend ordered the Chopped salad and the portion is about 2/3 of what it used to be on the old menu.  The bread basket consisted of 4 tiny pieces of bread that looked like it had seen better days.  They also took away the flatbread - which was the best part of the bread basket!

They changed the wine menu and my pour for a $16 glass of Peju was awful - if I was a bartender I would be embarrassed serving such a paltry amount.

Even the service was bad.  One bartender (new) who ignored us the the entire time.

Note to management:  Either restore the old menu and raise the prices or change the restaurant to a more casual atmosphere where you can get away with serving cheap food.

Finally!! 

I've had the Charcoal Room on my list of eats since I moved out here a few years ago.  My neighbor, some co-workers, and even friends/family from California even recommended the Charcoal Room to me. But when it came to other Yelpers, most haven't been here or reviewed them.  The Charcoal Room has a lot of pros and very little cons.  You don't get what you pay for here, you get more.  And if you're having steak, you get a lot more.  I got their petite filet and it was delicious.  Their petite is about 6 oz, juicy, and most importantly, very tasty. Don't let the price fool you.  For less than $30, I had a steak that rivals some of the 5 star steak houses out here.  My filet was so tender that I think I used a butter knife to cut through it.  I had my steak with a side of their Caesar salad, lobster corn chowder, sautéed mushrooms, and asparagus.  All portions were huge and I ended up with leftovers. My GF opted for their roasted chicken and baked sweet potato.  Her meal was hooked up too.  I swear she was served half a chicken and a football sized sweet potato.  She said her meal was good as well.  

I have no complaints about the service.  We were seated right away, our orders were taken, and our food was served in a timely manner.  I left the Charcoal Room very satisfied and my only regret is not coming here sooner.  We got a lot of food and paid less than $100 for it.  Yes...I'm sure I will be back.


PS: No pictures of their steak and no pictures of their fabulous forks.  I was focused the night I ate here....focused on my beautiful date.  1OAK!

Great manager, he came to the table at beginning to welcome our table. Started with wine, bread, 3 varieties We had ceasar salad, shared a bone in rib eye, 20oz. And potatoe. Our table had broiled scallops and asperagus. Delisious.

Charcoal Room, we are breaking up.  It's not me it's you, you have changed and not for the better.  Last week my husband and I went to T-Bones Chophouse at Red Rock, and it made me miss The Charcoal Room.  So this week we made our reservations, and I had one thing on my mind, boneless baby back ribs.  My most favorite thing here has changed.  I thought they were made of pork but these were beef and seemed like instead of baby backs, they were more like spare ribs.  They changed the meat and the quality on me and kept the price.  Sad day. 

We had reservations at five, but they didn't open on time.  Service wasn't as good as it was before and I felt like we got a little attitude because we didn't order alcohol.  The last slap was a cheap "Thank You" take out bag and generic Styrofoam to go containers instead of the classic red string reusable bag they had before.  I know it seems silly, but if you are spending sixty dollars plus a head for dinner, dressing up and bother to make a reservation, you want a good experience right down the the last detail.  The search for a new favorite is on.
